edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image

Class WritableImageImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.ReadOnlyImageImpl
      • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.WritableImageImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Image, WritableImage, Serializable, Iterable<ImageCoordinate>, Collection<ImageCoordinate>

    public class WritableImageImpl
extends ReadOnlyImageImpl
implements WritableImage
    A basic read-write implementation of WritableImage.

    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller
    See Also:
    WritableImage, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WritableImageImpl

        public WritableImageImpl(loci.formats.meta.IMetadata m,
                 WritablePixelData p)
        Constructs a new WritableImage with the specified metadata and PixelData.

        The metadata and PixelData should already be initialized (and should contain consistent values for things like dimension sizes).

        This constructor is primarily used by classes that read images in binary format; most users will probably want to use a different constructor.

        Parameters:
        m - An object containing the metadata associated with the Image (as a loci.formats.meta.IMetadata, to ease integration with the LOCI bio-formats library).
        p - A PixelData object containing the actual values at each pixel in the Image.

      • WritableImageImpl

        public WritableImageImpl(Image toCopy)
        Constructs a new WritableImage that is a (deep) copy of the specified Image. The pixel data will be copied exactly, but no guarantee is made that the metadata will be completely copied; only the minimally necessary metadata (like dimension sizes) will definitely be copied.
        Parameters:
        toCopy - The Image to copy.

      • WritableImageImpl

        public WritableImageImpl(ImageCoordinate dimensionSizes,
                 float initialValue)
        Constructs a new WritableImage with specified dimension sizes and all the pixel values set to some specified initial value. Bare-bones metadata will also be constructed.

        (Note that even though ImageCoordinates are zero-indexed, the ImageCoordinate's components should be the actual sizes of the dimensions, not the indices of those dimensions. For instance, for an 512 x by 512 y by 1 z plane by 1 color by 1 timepoint image, the ImageCoordinate specifying sizes should have components = (512, 512, 1, 1, 1), not (511, 511, 0, 0, 0).)

        Parameters:
        dimensionSizes - An ImageCoordinate whose components will be the sizes of each dimension of the Image.
        initialValue - The initial value to which all the pixels will be set.

      • WritableImageImpl

        public WritableImageImpl(BufferedImage bufferedImage)
        Constructs a new WritableImage from a java standard BufferedImage.
        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - The BufferedImage to convert to an Image.

      • WritableImageImpl

        public WritableImageImpl(ij.ImagePlus imPl)
        Constructs a new WritableImage from an ImageJ ImagePlus.
        Parameters:
        imPl - The ImagePlus to convert to an Image.

      • WritableImageImpl

        protected WritableImageImpl()
        Default constructor that subclasses may use to do the initialization themselves.

    • Method Detail

      • resize

        public void resize(ImageCoordinate newSize)
        Resizes the image to the size specified in the ImageCoordinate.

        Any image data that is still within the bounds of the new size will be transfered. Other image data will be discarded; regions previously outside the image will be filled with zeros.

        Any existing box of interest will be erased on calling this method.

        Specified by:
        resize in interface WritableImage
        Parameters:
        newSize - an ImageCoordinate containing the new size of each dimension of the image.

      • copy

        public void copy(Image other)
        Copies the pixel values of another Image into this Image. Any existing pixel values are overwritten. Metadata is not copied. The two Images must be the same size; this is not checked.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface WritableImage
        Parameters:
        other - The Image whose pixel values will be copied.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(ImageCoordinate coord,
            float value)
        Sets the value of the Image at the specified Image Coordinate. No bounds checking is performed.
        Specified by:
        setValue in interface WritableImage
        Parameters:
        coord - The ImageCoordinate at which to set the Image's value.
        value - The value to which to set the Image at the specified coordinate.

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
        Queries whether this Image's implementation can support writing.
        Specified by:
        isWritable in interface Image
        Overrides:
        isWritable in class ReadOnlyImageImpl
        Returns:
        true, as this instance is writable.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws Throwable
        Just calls super.finalize() for now.
        Overrides:
